DOC.brief_summary: To assess performance of resp rate parameter in a monitoring system PCBA-1
DOC.brief_title: Pulse Oximetry- Evaluating Resp Rate- PCBA-1
DOC.criteria: 1. Male or female subjects ages 18 or older. 2. Subject is willing and able to provide written consent. 1. Subject has severe contact allergies that may cause a reaction to standard adhesive materials found in pulse oximetry sensors, ECG electrodes, respiration monitor electrodes or other medical sensors. 2. Subjects with abnormalities that may prevent proper application of the device. 3. Subjects with significant Arrhythmia, as determined by subject selfreport during screening and I/E criteria assessment at study start. (Three events of irregularities in radial pulse within thirty seconds). 4. Women who are pregnant or lactating.
